title: SingularMatrixException with Shap KernelExplainer on SVM
body:
Hello, 

Sorry if this is a duplicate post, but I searched for it and didn't find the answer. 

I'm getting a SingularMatrixException with the KernelExplainer on SVM. My setup is that I do a k-fold cross-validation on SVM and after the training, I run the test samples on the SVM to get the predicted probabilities and the feature importances through Shap's KernelExplainer. I use a single sample of mean features as my background sample. 

                       background = np.zeros((1, len(features)))
                        try:
                            estimator.predict_proba(background)
                            explainer = shap.KernelExplainer(estimator.predict_proba, background, link="logit")
                            shap_values = explainer.shap_values(x_test, nsamples=100)
                        except Exception as e:
                            print("Got exception: " + str(e) + " on " + str(data_set))
                            shap_values = []

From time to time, I get the following exception: 

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "linear_stats_plots.py", line 482, in <module>
    shap_values = explainer.shap_values(x_test, nsamples=100)
  File "/home/ubuntu/miniconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/shap/explainers/kernel.py", line 203, in shap_values
    explanations.append(self.explain(data, **kwargs))
  File "/home/ubuntu/miniconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/shap/explainers/kernel.py", line 366, in explain
    vphi, vphi_var = self.solve(self.nsamples / self.max_samples, d)
  File "/home/ubuntu/miniconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/shap/explainers/kernel.py", line 483, in solve
    tmp2 = np.linalg.inv(np.dot(np.transpose(tmp), etmp))
  File "/home/ubuntu/miniconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/numpy/linalg/linalg.py", line 532, in inv
    ainv = _umath_linalg.inv(a, signature=signature, extobj=extobj)
  File "/home/ubuntu/miniconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/numpy/linalg/linalg.py", line 89, in _raise_linalgerror_singular
    raise LinAlgError("Singular matrix")
numpy.linalg.linalg.LinAlgError: Singular matrix

One odd thing is that I don't always get this exception: it depends on the iteration. I would appreciate any insights on this. Thank you very much!
